newsitem.title: CHINA: Jan-April industrial output of China's Hainan up.
newsitem.headline: Jan-April industrial output of China's Hainan up.

text.p: The industrial output of China's southernmost island province of Hainan jumped a year-on-year 17.1 percent to 1.5 billion yuan ($180.7 million) in the first four months of 1997, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.
Consumer retail sales in Hainan, one of China's fastest growing regions, rose 14.6 percent to 4.32 billion yuan in the first four months compared with the year-ago period, Xinhua said.
Retail price inflation in Hainan, the biggest of China's five Special Economic Zones, fell 6.2 percentage points in April compared with the same 1996 period, it said without elaborating.

The prospects for Hainan's agricultural output this year were good, with early rice output climbing to 820,000 tonnes and fruit and vegetables output increasing to 1.8 million tonnes, Xinhua said but gave no comparative figures.
